id: Certificate of Lawful Development (proposed) for a conversion of a single-dwelling house into a HMO (6-bed), including changes to windows at rear.

id: Installation of Electric Vehicle Charging Infrastructure in the carriageway adjacent to Victoria Mansions

id: Erection of a single storey ground floor rear / side extension.
Demolition of an existing garage with the erection of a single storey outbuilding to the rear garden, Flat A.

Rear garden T2 - Fig tree (Ficus carica) - Reduce spread to north by around 3m through removal of selected lower lateral limbs on north side. Reduce remaining crown to the most recent previous reduction points, removing approx. 2m of new growth. Final height 4m and final overall spread 5m.
Erection of a single storey ground floor rear side infill extension. (to the ground floor flat)

T1 - Horse Chestnut - to reduce crown by 30%-40% (4m) to old reduction points This tree is getting quit large for the gardens and could do with managing, reducing to where it has been reduced to before. The tree is around 18m in height and will be reduced to 14m.
Application for a Certificate of Lawful Development (Proposed) for the replacement of rear patio doors for like-for-like higher-performance, triple glazed patio doors.
Application for a Certificate of Lawful Development (Proposed) with respect to the installation of loft insulation, internal wall insulation and double glazing.
Rear garden: T1 Walnut. Crown reduce by approximately 3 m to reduce shading and tree debris. T2 Apple. Crown reduce by up to 2 m to contain size and development.

Application for a Certificate of Lawful Development (Proposed) with respect to retrofitting works to the property, involving loft insulation, draught proofing, internal wall insulation, insulated doors, and the replacement of windows with double-glazing windows.
Application for a Certificate of Lawfulness (Proposed) with respect to the installation of loft insulation and double glazing.

Display of High-quality lettering and branding related to the Skills Centre and Places for London, Informational content regarding training programmes, community engagement, and employment pathways, and Signage zones designed to integrate with the existing blockwork and roller shutters. No illuminated signage is proposed. All elements are non-reflective and securely affixed to the facade or hoarding.

Approval of details pursuant to condition 4(Construction Logistics Plan) of planning permission 20/04481/FUL (Demolition of existing buildings and erection of 3 storey building plus setback roof level to provide a 297sqm floorspace of commercial unit (Use Class E) at ground floor level and 14 residential units (Use Class C3) at first, second and third floor levels comprising 2 x studio, 4 x 1 bed, 6 x 2 bed and 2 x 3 bed units, together with the provision of bin and cycle storage) granted on 31.03.2023.
